Reviews.Title: Recommended (if you don't care about sound)
Reviews.Author: Brian S Williams
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV to be used in my bedroom for basic cable and Netflix via Wii or Roku. This is my second Toshiba LCD, as I was very pleased with the 42" I bought 3 years ago.I generally like everything about Toshiba TVs... good performance for moderate price, sensible menus and controls, quality, etc...That said, this TV sounds bad. If you care about sound and don't want to break the bank, I highly recommend Samsung's entry level models. I planned from the beginning to plug this Toshiba into a Pioneer receiver for sound, so I didn't even check the sound in the store. So, the poor quality sound doesn't effect me, but if you don't plan to use external speakers and a receiver, the sound might be a deal-breaker for you.Otherwise I am thrilled with everything else about this purhcase and have no regrets. I would have given it 5 stars if it had excellent sound.

Reviews.Title: Good picture, bad sound
Reviews.Author: T. Clark
Reviews.Content: Purchased this TV from a big box store nearby after deciding it would be quicker than waiting for a Samsung from Amazon.  The TV is for my daughters bedroom.  The picture is fine - we have it hooked up to U-Verse via HDMI.  But the sound is awful.  It's bad enough that I'm debating returning it just for that.  It's like it only has tweeters - no midrange or woofers.  You have to turn it up really loud to understand dialogue.  Because of its use in a bedroom the sound really isn't that critical.  I'll give my daughter a week to adjust to the sound. If she's still not happy I'll take it back.  It's sad that the Emprex TV it's replacing sounded so much better.  Five stars for value, 4 stars for picture, 1 star for sound.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful clear picture
Reviews.Author: Richard G.
Reviews.Content: I had already bought the 26" version of this set and was so pleased with the picture quality that I went for the 32". I have satellite TV and the HD image run through these TV's is stunning in it's clarity. If you can, do use the cables from your cable box to connect up, instead of just the standard coax. It's a knock out. Toshiba makes good quality televisions and they kept the price down, with these budget sets. Oh, and if you are like me, and you were agonizing about whether to spend the extra dough, to buy a 1080p TV versus a 720P? The need for the 1080p only comes into play when you get into the 46" screens and beyond. Don't throw your money away thinking that you've got to do that. The clarity of this 32" is perfect. My friend just bought a 46" Sony 1080p for about a thousand bucks. Yup, the picture quality is the same as mine. Speakers: the TV makers pretty much assume that folks are running their sound through their home audio or stereos, as I am, so the cabinet speakers are not deluxe for that reason. It's a non issue. Also, rear port damage is usually caused by overly strained cables (the morons who make the HD cables seem to think 6' is long enough, I use a longer and softer cord for the connections to the back of the TV). Lastly, many thanks to the folks who took the time to review this television on the site here, because it helped me a lot, as usual.

Reviews.Title: Great value for a selective bunch
Reviews.Author: Autistic Aaron
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent, quality television for the price.  It features your average customizable settings for picture; you can choose from presets or alter individual settings (contrast/brightness, tint, backlighting, and dynamic contrast) to your tastes.  Picture can be displayed in standard 16:9, 4:3, and three "TheaterWide" options (a Toshiba thing that I never really understood -- possibly put in place to fill the screen as best as possible for videos rendered in anything other than 16:9 or 4:3.)Inputs run the gamut of 2 HDMI ports, one component-in, two A/V-in, a digital audio port, and antenna-in.  I imagine this is plenty for anyone buying a 32" television -- I use a receiver, thus, I only utilize a single HDMI port.  Even without a receiver, you've got the option of three HD inputs and two SD inputs, not including the standard antenna/TV-in.For gamers, the "Gaming Mode" should NOT be overlooked -- it minimizes the post-processing of the video signal to reduce the refresh rate as much as possible.  This translates to quicker reaction times from controller to display.  This can be especially helpful for rhythm/music games and fighting games, where split-millisecond inputs can make or break your experience.  I'm a big fan of the former, and for a LCD television, it definitely satisfies.  It isn't a perfect 0ms, but it's not far off.Other features include closed captioning, channel labeling, energy saving, locks based on channel rating and/or PIN code, sleep timer, and three languages for the menus -- English, Spanish, and French.  The remote control is no-frills, and can be programmed to control your DVD and/or Blu-Ray player.  It certainly isn't the most attractive remote control, but there are aftermarket options for those that need their coffee table or nightstand to look as good as their home theater setup.As for the selective bunch, there really isn't anything to complain about IF you use a receiver and surround sound system as opposed to the built-in speakers, and if 1080p isn't necessary for your needs.  It should be noted that this television does render in 1080i, but 720p is preferred for sharpness and clarity.  I tested the built-in speakers to see what others were complaining about, and they are certainly entitled to this gripe -- it's pretty bad.  For that, I docked a star.I've owned this television for around six months, and I love it.  Personally, I would give this television five stars for its value -- I got a great deal on it.  Considering current market prices, I can't appropriate the need for LED-LCD, 1080p, 3D, etc.  For those using a receiver with a separate sound system, this is certainly a five star value.  My family and I have owned nothing but Toshiba and Sony televisions for the past 20 years, and neither brands have let us down yet -- Toshiba makes reliable, quality televisions.

Reviews.Title: Possible Workaround for Audio
Reviews.Author: Greg Burton
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews that criticized the audio quality of this television and I purchased the TV anyway.What I have noticed is that when the TV sits on a tabletop on the supplied stand, that the sound fromthe bottom mounted speakers bounce off of the table surface and seems somewhat distorted. But, when Imounted the TV on the wall, the speakers were no longer obstructed and the sound became acceptable.The video quality is as good as described in other reviews.

Reviews.Title: Great image, terrible sound, terrible sound options
Reviews.Author: DMR89
Reviews.Content: We bought this TV for a steal when it was on sale.  Unfortunately, we had no idea how bad the sound actually was until we turned it on and heard it.  The other reviews warned us, but we thought that if it were an issue, we could simply attach a set of speakers and be OK.  We were WRONG.The sound quality of the TV speakers are terrible.  It really does sound like you're listening to a laptop computer.  Everything is tinny.  We tried to go around that by hooking up a set of 2.1 speakers we had lying around, except that this TV only has one audio out port and it is for digital optical audio (Toslink) cables.  I had no idea what those were until I did more research online.  As it turns out, its an audio cable format that is really only used by audio receivers and other high end audio equipment.  So if you don't have an expensive audio receiver and surround sound set, you won't have any GOOD way of connecting external speakers.Not wanting to return the TV, we cobbled together the next best solution.  We bought a Toslink (digital optical audio) cable from Amazon as well as a Toslink to Analog RCA converter box.  We then ran the Toslink cable out from the TV into the converter box, then a set of RCA cables into our 2.1 speaker system.  The end result is that we have great sound quality, but it comes at a bizarre cost.  We have not been able to control the volume through the remote control.  I have no idea why, but the audio out doesn't seem to be volume controlled by the TV.  Thus, we have to use the little dial on the speaker set to adjust the volume.  It's annoying for sure, but not the end of the world.So, if you don't have an audio receiver, I would avoid this TV.  You'll hate the sound.

Reviews.Title: Worst sound ever
Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV based on picture quality and price.  It seemed to have the nicest picture, just barely, of the 32" TV's priced around $300, at least as they were set up and configured in the store.  I didn't think to check the sound in the store.  I don't consider myself all that picky when it comes to TV sound, at least I've never felt the desire to add a fancy audio system to any TV.  The built-in speakers on every TV set I've owned have always been just fine in the past.  Not an issue.  I don't think I've ever heard a TV and thought to myself, "Wow, what horrible sound!"  ...until I bought this Toshiba.  Very tinny sound, no bass and practically no mid-range.  A cheap radio would sound better.  There is no owner's manual with this TV, just a quick guide sheet for basic setup which is NOT very informative.  The remote also looks cheap.  I hate to return items, but as soon as I turned on this TV set I knew it was going back to the store.  There is no way I can get used to that awful sound.  I have no desire to pay more money to add a sound system, which I'm guessing would have to be a rather expensive system since this TV only has digital audio out.  It's hard to believe Toshiba would put out a TV with sound this awful.

Reviews.Title: Very Poor Sound
Reviews.Author: KEKE
Reviews.Content: This Tv functions well, but the sound is poor. There are time I find myself having to increase the volume to the loudest. The picture is good but that sound, I mean poor!! I am quite disappointed with the sound, I would not by another Toshiba.

Reviews.Title: Horrible Audio
Reviews.Author: Ronald E. Harris Jr. "Ron"
Reviews.Content: The sound from this television reminds of my old AM radio I had when I was a kid. Right out of the box I had to crank the volume to hear it. Plus the audio would cut out randomly. Called Toshiba Support and they could not figure it out. I tried using a signal amplifier. That made my picture sharper but still had the audio problem. Connect the TV in a different room (shorter cable length) and still had the problem. Called a TV repair center under warrenty. Now we are waiting on a part. This from a 2 month old TV. Beware. Buy a different TV.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware Terrible stand-alone sound quality!
Reviews.Author: mscman45
Reviews.Content: Great digital picture quality-no problems with that. NO MENTION AT ALL in the Amazon ad for this TV about how poor the sound quality is or that it absolutely would need to be amplified through a home theater set-up. It does not have a 1/8 inch stereo plug (analog) so you have to buy a more expensive digital audio optical cable to connect it to a digital audio amplification system. No user manual included as well (found it online 50+ pages pdf document) so really difficult to figure out what exactly the system requirements were. Big pain in the behind to find this all out after the purchase was made (a gift for someone else and I just found out 6 months after the fact). Grr!

Reviews.Title: Awesome Product!!!!
Reviews.Author: HDTV Fan
Reviews.Content: Before reading his tip, the colors and detail was fine, but the picture was a little dim, and although I could live with it, I wasn't really happy with it at the time."The picture looks excellent, however, I did need to make a lot of changes to the menu settings to achieve this - the picture is too dark at default settings but the two key settings to remedy this are the energy saver settings and backlight intensity.Turn off energy saving and crank up the backlight and you have a very bright picture, the remaining settings can be easily calibrated to your preference.Make no mistake, I love the picture quality and the screen itself has low reflection."After turning off the energy save mode, the picture was actually TOO bright, and I had to turn down the back light, and Gamma, and contrast a little. Back light got turned down 20% and it still may be too bright.Turning that Energy Save mode off, made all the difference. There was a sharp increase in brightness when I turned that off. I was so pleased I wanted to share, because it is a shame that this TV gets some bad reviews, as it really is excellent as far as sound, and picture quality(once you turn that power save mode off)Thanks to US of Andy for that tip! I had previously tried everything I could find, and although it was okay, I wasn't satisfied...

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 32C110U 32-Inch 720p LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: C. Stewart "Cinbad"
Reviews.Content: Day 1 - Good picture and good sound.  Right price and nice size for bedroom usage.I was concerned about taking this out of the box after my hubby purchased it due to the reviews I read here on Amazon. Other reviews raise a number of issues regarding the sound.  So far no problem.  We've paired this with a Samsung wireless blu-ray and everything looks great.  Maybe it's because the tv we replaced in the bedroom was 19 inches and over 10 years old.I'll update if anything changes - but we're pretty happy with it right now!

Reviews.Title: Its great despite the sound!!!
Reviews.Author: nikkosant
Reviews.Content: This TV picture is great I bought it for my 'mini gym' downstairs and it works fine the room is not quite small and the sound is not sufficient but I bought a sound bar for $240.00 and it works fine I have equipment in different parts of the room and i am able to hear from all areas.I connected Uverse to it and all in all it works fine!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Don't like the sound, bad HDMI port
Reviews.Author: hrndnwmn "hrndnwmn"
Reviews.Content: Sounds like a transistor radio, even with the bass turned all the way up and the treble all the way down. It's going back. Also there was a problem with the HDMI port, the slightest move caused a disconnect. Nice picture though.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Paper Weight
Reviews.Author: Duncan Macleod
Reviews.Content: Unit stopped working less than 3 months after purchase.  Black screen, solid green LED for a few seconds.  Contacted Toshiba Support.  Toshiba Support diagnosed a bad main board.  Referred the case to a company called Nexicore.  I have contacted Nexicore twice.  I was on hold for 30 minutes each time.  The first time just to confirm that the ticket had been created.  10 days later I stayed on hold for 30 minutes for them to tell me they still didn't have the board and have no idea when they will receive it.  I guess you get what you pay for.Edit:  18 days after reporting this issue to Toshiba the problem has still not been resolved.  I called Toshiba yesterday and they informed me that not enough time had passed for them to "escalate my case".  This will be my first and last Toshiba purchase.Edit 2:  After more than one month Toshiba offered a refurbished unit or a refund.  I chose the refund.  Once I have received the refund I will consider the matter closed.  I am pleased that Toshiba resolved the issue but their disinterest in resolving this matter in a timely fashion will prohibit me from using their products in the future.

Reviews.Title: Do Not Buy this TV Unless you want to sit on top of it to hear it.
Reviews.Author: rocky
Reviews.Content: We purchased this TV on August 4th and had it wall mounted.  We couldn't hear it at maximum from 6 feet away. We called Toshiba customer service on August 6th, they gave us a claim number and told us to remove it from the wall and put it on a table, to see if it would make a difference.  We did that and it still didn't work any better. We drove back to Electronics Express where we bought it, to get a refund an were tokd the return warranty had expired, and to contact the company.  We contacted the company again, and we were told that the speakers were 7 watts only , and that this TV is meant to be sold with a sound system. We are on a fixed income and we were not aware of this at the onset, otherwise we would not have bought this TV.  The Toshiba agent said it was our fault and we should have done our homework. I thought that was rude, so I called back a few days later, and spoke to a supervisor. They agreed to send a repairman to change the sound board, and it didn't change a thing. I called Toshiba back and they sent me to "upper management", requested my money back, but in the end she too just said "too bad, can't do anything for you. She repeated the same statement 3 times from a script they read to the customer".Sad thing is many people are falling prey to this kind of "who cares attitude in a disposable world" JUST BEWARE.Two things I know: No more Electronics Express, and no more Toshiba for us. Let's bring manufacturing back to America, where it used to be we got something for our hard earned money.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba warranty is the worst I ever had to deal with
Reviews.Author: ShineBrazil
Reviews.Content: The TV was defective. It turns on and turns off right away. I called the Toshiba customer service and it took them about a month and a half to send the first part. The local authorized technician came to my house and couldn't fix it. He had to order parts twice after this and come back to my house. In another words he has been at my house 3 times and couldn't fix it. Called corporate office and after 3 months they finally approved to send me a new one. They sent a label to my e-mail and promised that they would ship the new one when my defective one was on transit. It has arrived there on Jun 27th and they still didn't ship me a new one. I called today again and customer service argued with me that they have received the TV on Friday. I said I had the proof of delivery of UPS and she argued that the 27th of June was the date that I shipped. I don't know if they think I am stupid or what, but I will never buy a Toshiba again or refer to anybody. It is the worst warranty that I ever had to deal with. It has been 4 months since I called the first time to their customer service. I have 6 different reference numbers for this case and it is still not resolved. Please do not buy Toshiba!!!

Reviews.Title: Disappointed..
Reviews.Author: Fellow Seller
Reviews.Content: Toshiba is supposed to be one of the better TV brands, I've never heard of anyone having any issues with one.  This is why I'm so disappointed with the one I have, it was a gift otherwise I would exchange it.  A lot of the reviews on here are about this TV's sound quality, poor sound quality is to be expected from any HDTV, it is meant to be paired with a receiver and custom speakers, they really aren't that expensive.  The issue I have with this TV is it's picture quality, which is obviously a real problem.  All black images, most notably people's eyes, leave a red trail.  It is extremely distracting! If you play around with the picture settings enough you can lessen the problem, however as soon as you turn the TV off all the settings are reset!  Another problem that is not as bad but still annoying is the fact that if you're watching cable and turn on your DVD player the TV automatically changes its input to DVD. I'm sure some people would appreciate this but I'd rather change it myself.  In short, you're better off with a Samsung!

Reviews.Title: sound
Reviews.Author: jfzeabart
Reviews.Content: consumer reports rated it as very poor on sound quality and it was, but I sent the sound output ,for a small price, to an audio amplifier and now have very good sound and superior picture quality The price for the TV was $70 less than listed in Consumer Reports

Reviews.Title: Sounds like a radio
Reviews.Author: Purple28
Reviews.Content: This tv would be perfect if the sound was better. I just got it today and I'm returning it tomorrow. The picture is great but whats the point of watching tv if the sound is horrible.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Dawn in Bradenton Beach
Reviews.Content: I have purchased a total of four of these tv's for one of our resorts, Tortuga Inn Beach Resort in Bradenton Beach, FL.  Two of them are being used in our Le Petit Cafe, one behind the counter of the front desk to display all of our properties and one for the master bedroom of one of our rental units.  They have a really nice picture and look good on the walls.As always, my purchases with Amazon have been easy with fast delivery.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture!
Reviews.Author: Khmer Preah Vihear
Reviews.Content: The picture is amazing! Yes, it is true, the audio isn't great, as most have commented.  But then again, nobody should be buying a 32" expecting dolby surround sound 5.1.  So if sound is truly what you desire in a TV, this TV will serve you better in a smaller room or don't get it at all.  Great brand for a great price at $250. Very Happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great tv especially for the price
Reviews.Author: MW
Reviews.Content: I don't really review items, but I am for this one just because of the concern the previous reviews gave me when I first purchased this tv.In the past month of using this tv, I've found that the sound has been good without any of the tinny-ness that others said they experienced.  I also have not adjusted my color settings at any point and all still looks good.  I switched to this tv from an Olevia 32inch which was acceptable or even good itself.  This tv, despite being the same in size, quality, and hertz feels like a dramatically better tv.  That is a compliment of this unit not a shot at the Olevia unit.I don't know if the problems in other reviews were unit-specific or if they were subsequently straightened out in more recently sold versions of this tv, but I personally highly recommend this tv.  I got mine at Sears for 250...so I would recommend holding off a bit if possible to get a better price.

Reviews.Title: worth my bucks
Reviews.Author: Marie
Reviews.Content: Everything is working fine so far. Im not giving it a perfect score because it's still to early for me to say

Reviews.Title: adequate picture, poor sound, quit working after 1-2 years
Reviews.Author: A. Jordan
Reviews.Content: We purchased this tv for back-up viewing and for my exercise videos. The picture is good enough. The sound is not great but that is true of all these new thin screen televisions. I am very unhappy that the set now will not turn on, period. Will take it to repair shop today. If they can fix the power supply with a kit then the cost might be around $75 and possible makes sense to repair. If it needs a new power supply, the cost will be about $125 and not worth it to repair. I would not buy Toshiba again.

Reviews.Title: Nice Upgrade
Reviews.Author: A. Paroli "Closet of Free Samples"
Reviews.Content: We had a 19" tv that was starting to go out on us so we started to look around for a replacement. This one was in our price range and had all the features we needed. We wanted to easily be able to hook up super nintendoes, N64, DVD player, Cable Box, etc and are pretty limited to our options to have all those set up at one. This TV offered the hook ups we needed and was easy to install. Also, the tv isn't too heavy either - just 30 pounds. Going from the 19" to a 32" feels like a real luxury for us! The picture is pretty clear with the exception of older movies where they begin to look kind of grainy, but I'm pretty sure that's because of how the movies were made and not the tv. We're pretty satisfied with our upgrade!

Reviews.Title: great choice
Reviews.Author: starr
Reviews.Content: I'm glad i choose this tv, its a nice size for my bedroom and it shows very good im glad i purchased and fast shipping thanks

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Garrett
Reviews.Content: Awesome tv for the price! Still works after a couple years and it was refurbished! Good gift for girl friend!

Reviews.Title: Great Picture Horrible Sound
Reviews.Author: Cassie P.
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv for my bedroom. I wanted a decent tv that wouldn't break me but was also big enough to actually see.The picture is clear and bright and just all around fantastic. I also really enjoy playing video games on it better than the tv in the living room because of the picture quality.That being said the sound is TERRIBLE! I have good hearing and I can be sitting directly in front of this tv with the volume all the way up and barely hear it. And if there is any other noise like a fan or my fish tank filter for example forget it I can't hear it at all unless I am right next to it.I ended up buying a separate sound system. Now everything is fine.I all in all love this tv. But wish I had known about the sound issues before buying it.

Reviews.Title: super
Reviews.Author: HoustonTroy "TP"
Reviews.Content: Put this is my mother's house.  It works well, standard def dvd's look very nice.  She only uses over the air signal so I can't attest to the ability with other tv sources.

Reviews.Title: Good gaming TV for the price!
Reviews.Author: DevK
Reviews.Content: Im a casual gamer. I mostly play FPS on my 360. So a good "quick" lcd is necessary to get the best gaming experience. I got tired of squinting at my 23 inch monitor and decided to switch it up to this Toshiba TV. Im noticing the difference! Definitely use the GAME-MODE. I'm liking the image quality so far and Im NOT noticing any ghosting or any noticeable input lag. My K/D ratios has gotten better. Maybe its the bigger screen or just placebo! Its worth the money. Get some speakers thou :)

Reviews.Title: ok tv but====I NEED HELP FROM ONE OF THE TV  EXPERTS OUT THERE
Reviews.Author: WWJ "WWJ"
Reviews.Content: Picture is good, sound ok if against wall otherwise sound is faint.  BUT HOW DO I GET RID OF THE BLACK BOX THAT APPEARS when the tv is on for a long time and idle, you have to turn the TV off and back on to make it disappear. No info on web site

Reviews.Title: Good buy
Reviews.Author: dk639
Reviews.Content: The Television is everything described.  It was easy set up and works great.  I would buy it again if needed.

Reviews.Title: Great value for the price
Reviews.Author: Sara Bear
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with our Toshiba TV. It's very lightweight, which makes it easy for me to move if I decide to rearrange. The picture is crystal clear and makes colours look so vivid. I haven't had any problems with the sound.My one disappointment was the remote control. It was very cheaply made and stopped working within a week. I also wish the top of the TV was a little thicker. It's rounded, which makes it impossible to mount a Wii sensor bar up there. Had to opt for mounting it in front of the TV instead.

Reviews.Title: TV watch
Reviews.Author: C. Cunningham
Reviews.Content: Only have this TV since January, but so far everything is working well. My son noticed some extra features such as hooking it to my computer for Netflix streaming. The sound is good and picture very clear. I purchased it during a special sale from Amazon, making it a good buy.

Reviews.Title: mr.ashok
Reviews.Author: Ashok "ashok"
Reviews.Content: As such it was a good TV but the greenish tint in the backhround was not adjustable like the one we have other Toshiba TV in our home.The picture quality was good.Unfortunately I had to return in exchange of other model of Toshiba TV.

Reviews.Title: Great T.V.
Reviews.Author: Charles F. Moore
Reviews.Content: I originally used an RF Modulator for a hook up between my Satellite Box and an old T.V. as the older T.V. didn't have the RCA jacks and I had also hooked up a VCR/DVD Video. When I got this Toshiba 32 inch I left it with the RF unit. The Picture wasn't that great . I hooked it  up later with the RCA jacks and the picture was great, I see no problem with the sound,

Reviews.Title: Great TV for a GReat Price
Reviews.Author: D. Katz "David K"
Reviews.Content: I replaced a much smaller TV with this one andit is being used for my orientations in business.The screen is large and the picture is real nice

Reviews.Title: Sound? Sounds good to me..
Reviews.Author: homesweethome57
Reviews.Content: I know everyone says the sound is bad... but it sounds fine to me.  Not sure what all the complaining is about.

Reviews.Title: Good Picture Horrible Sound
Reviews.Author: N. Sharkey
Reviews.Content: Like everyone said this sound is horrible I bought this tv for my grandma and had to go out and get a sound bar. Even though the tv is offered at a low price it is not a steal, you have to buy external equipment just to hear it and in the end it costs close to $400. You could have bought a bigger and nicer tv with that kind of money. If you want a tv that sounds and looks good but the cost is low go with the TCL. It's an unknown name but an excellent tv and it comes with a 2 year warrenty.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal
Reviews.Author: Thrown
Reviews.Content: This was a great deal for the price. The sound is lacking and you will need a digital home system to enhance the sound. The picture is good but not as bright as the high end models - but then again - the price is great

Reviews.Title: Very nice Tv
Reviews.Author: tc
Reviews.Content: This TV brought great joy to my grandparent's. They still rant about how it is the nicest tv they have ever owned.

Reviews.Title: great tv for this price range
Reviews.Author: A. Woodard "inrckymtwest"
Reviews.Content: Good picture, no weird rainbow effects on fast moving action.  VGA input nice for use as a computer monitor.

Reviews.Title: Awesome value
Reviews.Author: Doug
Reviews.Content: This tv was so cheap and the quality is great..recommend this tv at $200.it is not a great tv for gamers but movies look fine at 1080i.

Reviews.Title: Not so good
Reviews.Author: Tushar
Reviews.Content: I got this TV after the sales guy recommended it. I was not thrilled with the quality. The TV on the whole doesn't look very good. I know I didn't pay a lot for it but then I think there is a certain level of quality that one can expect. The stand is of a plastic sort of a material, flimsy looking. The picture quality isn't very good either. Standard definition looks just awful. I was also a little confused with the picture size formatting. The only way I could have picture on the whole screen was by using the 'Theatre Mode' but then the picture looked too stretched and unwatchable. Fast moving objects blur. Its a 60Hz 720p alright, but there is better out there. The only thing good I thought was the sound. But if I want sound I'd buy a music system.

Reviews.Title: quality
Reviews.Author: F. E. Hayward
Reviews.Content: The shipment price and condition on arrival were fine. The product is only fair. I bought a 32 inch smsung a week before I bought this Toshiba and the samsung is a much better tv far better picture and sound. I will and would recommend any furture purchases of TV be Samsung.Frank Haywardcactus1928@aol.com

Reviews.Title: toshiba tv
Reviews.Author: jcskydriver
Reviews.Content: We finally bought a this toshiba after are tube tv died and did some research on flat screens. I bought the 17inch after my tube died in the office.  There both great tv and really nice screen quantity.  So, both I recommend ..

Reviews.Title: sound is awful
Reviews.Author: craig
Reviews.Content: The sound is awful don't get it buy a lg or Samsung. I sell this TV where i work at and it gets returned dally for the poor sound guilty or lack of sound. I own the Samsung 32 TV it works and sounds great.

Reviews.Title: know they have problem w/sound and don't care
Reviews.Author: mike twain
Reviews.Content: complained about this tv to toshiba and h.h.gregg and everybody knows the sound sucks even at max volume and they suggest you buy theater system to make sound better, even try to talk to managers at toshiba but they pretended to not speak very good english so i've learned my lesson with toshiba, my mistake this is their 2nd junk tv i've owned.

Reviews.Title: Don't use it as  a monitor
Reviews.Author: Sean Dougherty
Reviews.Content: It's probably a great TV for the money but don't try to use it as a computer monitor.  The resolution isn't good enough for close-in viewing.

Reviews.Title: ok picture
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: This TV kind of lacks the power and sharpness of many other LCD. Now is the time for LED displays and LCDs are kind of outdated. LED is definitely the display of the future

Reviews.Title: Vertical lines are coming
Reviews.Author: jtech50
Reviews.Content: Toshiba's are known for what's called vertical banding so you can expect to begin seeing them in 18-24 months. Good luck with Toshiba's support because it's non-existent!

Reviews.Title: I got this TV free and still feel ripped off
Reviews.Author: SiamIam
Reviews.Content: I got this TV free.  I want my time and money back.  I do not know what the designers were thinking when they drew up the plans for this TV.  The picture quality is OK for 720p.  That's the best thing to say about the TV.  It comes with a fold out setup sheet for its manual.  To get the full manual you have to go to the website, and good luck there for help.  They have it setup for -all- HDMI connections AND the PC connection go through 1 single 3.5mm headphone jack... Not RCA... Not fiber... an RCA jack.  The fold out manual doesn't tell you this.  Neither does the online manual, except in one picture... just calls it an audio jack.  Changing inputs it likes to stop at each and every one, so you can't just go from HDMI to composite, you have to go through every single one back around to it, every time.  Do yourself a favor and look around for something else.

ProductInfo.Features:
720p Resolution
DynaLight increases detail and depth of the images on your screen
USB Connection
2 HDMI w/CEC,PC Input
Limited Warranty: 1 Year Parts & Labor
ProductInfo.Name: Toshiba 32C110U 32-Inch 720p LCD HDTV, Black (2011 Model)
